reference_a:
@article{pronizius2024,
  title = {Everyday helping is associated with enhanced mood but greater stress when it is more effortful},
  author = {Pronizius, Ekaterina and Forbes, Paul A. G. and Feneberg, Anja C. and Miculescu, Bianca and Nater, Urs M. and Piperno, Giulio and Silani, Giorgia and Stijovic, Ana and Lamm, Claus},
  date = {2024-10-15},
  journaltitle = {Scientific Reports},
  shortjournal = {Sci Rep},
  volume = {14},
  number = {1},
  pages = {24120},
  publisher = {Nature Publishing Group},
  issn = {2045-2322},
  doi = {10.1038/s41598-024-75261-z}
}
topics: helping, mood, prosocial behavior, stress, COVID
additional_comments: burst 1 in the paper, more description on EMA variables: https://osf.io/kaf9e

features.name: helping_binary
features.coding:
Since the last data entry, have you helped or supported someone?
0 = no
1 = yes

features.name: helping_effort
features.coding:
How effortful was this helping or support?
0 = not at all
100 = very much

features.name: stress
features.coding:
At the moment, I feel stressed
0 = not at all
100 = very much

features.name: valence_mood
features.coding:
Mean of two bipolar items: unwell-well and dissatisfied-satisfied
0 = not at all
100 = very much
Adapted multidimensional mood questionnaire

features.name: calmness_mood
features.coding:
Mean of two bipolar items: tense-relaxed and restless-calm
0 = not at all
100 = very much
Adapted multidimensional mood questionnaire

features.name: energy_mood
features.coding:
Mean of two bipolar items: weak-energetic and tired-awake
0 = not at all
100 = very much
Adapted multidimensional mood questionnaire

features.name: ema_time
features.coding: Time of the day in hours since midnight

features.name: freetime
features.coding:
0 = current data entry while working/studying
1 = during free time

features.name: social_binary
features.coding:
Were there any social interactions since the last data entry?
0 = No
1 = Yes
